author: mightypenguin
content: Fee is ~80gwei and we aren't deflationary now. According to ultrasound.Money. We need to be burning >2eth per block. Largely because of mostly empty blocks.

author: sky.cactus
content: Not-full blocks are working as intended.

author: sky.cactus
content: As of London, we should no longer expect long streams of full blocks, and in fact that would be very surprising and rare.

author: mightypenguin
content: There's at least one miner creating fairly empty blocks though... Hopefully not a "protest" of 1559 or intentional.

author: liberosist
content:
Like I said, post-Merge. Target for 0 inflation pre-Merge is 150+ gwei. 

On a different note, the average block is approximately 50% full, so 1559 is working as intended. The variance between blocks can be smoother, though this may be resolved with more wallets supporting 1559-style transactions and as things settle down. It would be foolish for a miner to deliberately mine an empty block, as they'll lose their revenues to the next miner mining a double sized block. Anyway, off topic for L2...
